title: Silton Forest Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: David Rogers / Silton Forest
images.caption: Car park and picnic area at the end of Moor Lane leading into Silton Forest.

images.title: Matthew Hatton / Silton Forest
images.caption: Looking down over the forest from Hambleton Street.

images.title: Matthew Hatton / National Cycle Network Track into Silton Forest
images.caption: National Cycle Network Track into Silton Forest. A good grade track, which led through the trees to a fast descent to Moor Lane.

images.title: Mick Garratt / Forest Ride, Silton Woods
images.caption: Forest Ride, Silton Woods. The top of a firebreak in the commercial forest.

images.title: Gordon Hatton / Forest track, Over Silton Moor
images.caption: Forest track, Over Silton Moor.  A well surfaced forest track which forms part of the national cycle network. Looking south towards Woolmoor.

description: Enjoy miles of mountain bike trails and footpaths in this large coniferous forest on the North York Moors. You can park on Moor Lane near to the village of Nether Stilton to start your exercise. A cycling and walking trail then runs to the north of the forest along National Cycle Route 65 . The tracks are great for mountain bikers with berms, humps, tight turns and drops. The Cleveland Way runs along the eastern fringe of the forest so you can pick this up to continue your walk. Heading north will take you across Thimbleby Moor to Osmotherley where you can enjoy a waterside walk around Cod Beck Reservoir . The video below shows a walk to the forest from there. Heading south will take you to Boltby Forest where there are more good trails to try.
